questions.question: Which UNESCO site, located in Egypt, holds the world's oldest known monumental sculpture associated with the Pharaoh Khafre?
questions.context: This limestone statue, believed to depict a lion with a human head, stands in the Giza Plateau alongside the renowned pyramids.

questions.question: Which architectural marvel in the United Arab Emirates became the world's tallest building upon its completion in 2010?
questions.context: This skyscraper held the record of the tallest structure at 828 meters and features a design inspired by regional desert flower patterns.

questions.question: Which historical battle site, famously depicted in a 19th-century painting, is where the Allied forces defeated Napoleon's army in 1815?
questions.context: This decisive battle took place near the town of Waterloo and effectively ended Napoleon Bonaparte’s rule as Emperor of the French.

questions.question: Which renowned European museum, home to masterpieces like the Mona Lisa, started as a fortress in the medieval times?
questions.context: Originally a 12th-century fortification, this now world-famous art museum and historical monument houses thousands of works, attracting millions annually.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Central America, known for the iconic El Castillo pyramid, is one of the large pre-Columbian Maya cities?
questions.context: Located on the Yucatán Peninsula, this archaeological site displays a sacred cenote and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1988.
